question: <image 1>A tractor-trailer truck is traveling down the road. The mass of the trailer is 4 times the mass of the tractor. If the tractor accelerates forward, the force that the trailer applies on the tractor is
options: ['4 times greater than the force of the tractor on the trailer.', '2 times greater than the force of the tractor on the trailer.', 'equal to the force of the tractor on the trailer.', '1/4 the force of the tractor on the trailer.']
description: The image depicts a simple illustration of a tractor-trailer truck. The tractor is shown in the front with two wheels visible, and it has the word "Tractor" written on its side. The trailer is attached to the tractor and is shown as a rectangular box with the word "Trailer" written inside it. The trailer has two wheels visible at the rear end. The overall design is minimalistic, focusing on the basic shapes and labels to represent the tractor and trailer components of the truck.
